feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Process Automation
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Process Automation Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How can we store static data in SAP Build Process Automation and access it in a Decision Table?
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), I want to store a set of static configuration data — for example, a JSON file that contains a list of Yes/No questions along with next-step logic.

I understand that BPA allows uploading static artifacts like JSON files into the project, but:

 My Questions:

  1. Can I access this static JSON data from within a Decision Table?

  2. If yes, how can I reference or read that static file inside a Decision Table?

  3. Is there a recommended way to make BPA Decision Tables dynamically configurable using such static files?

 What I'm Trying to Do:

I want to avoid hardcoding all rows in the Decision Table. Instead, I’d prefer:

  • Storing a JSON or CSV file with the step-by-step rules

  • Having the Decision Table evaluate against that static data

  • Or programmatically update the table from that file (if possible)

Example JSON I want to use:

[
    {
        "step": 1,
        "question": "Is the requestor an employee?",
        "yesNext": 2,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    },
    {
        "step": 2,
        "question": "Is the budget approved?",
        "yesNext": 3,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    }
]
SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: SAP BPA API Trigger Job Expired
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm having a problem trying to execute several API Trigger in a row. Sometimes the last job is not executed and it ends with status Expired:

Each time it fails, these are the status through which the job is changing:

I looked for the Agent log in that instant and I found this error:

But according to the Agent, it was available at the time of this execution. It's always the last job that fails and if the API Trigger is called 3 times, it is supposed to stack these executions, so I don't know why it is not executing the last one.

 

The project is deployed in the Public Environment and the number of calls for the API Trigger varies.

Any idea?

Thanks experts.

entry.title: Error when binding list input in Approval Form (SAP Build Process Automation)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm working on a process in SAP Build Process Automation where I have a user task ("Request Approval") that should display a list of items coming from the input data model.

In the "Inputs" tab of the Approval Form, I'm trying to bind a list to the form.

However, I encountered an issue, as shown in the screenshot below.

Is this a bug on SAP Build Process Automation side, or am I missing something in the configuration?

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,

Giang Pham

entry.title: SAP IRPA/BPA Excel formulas not calculated when cell values set by bot
entry.content:
Hi, I am facing issue as per the subject. I need to pass dates from SAP to prepared excel where it does some calculations. When I enter the dates (to cells that are formatted as date), these excel formulas (instead of getting correct values) are giving me 04.01.1900. I thought it could be some format issue when taking data from SAP. But even when I try to get and manipulate values only within excel, it does the same. As a last resort I tried to reenter these formulas. So after I set cell B2 and C2 with date I put formula to column I2. result is still the same. When setting these B2, C2 cells as a user, everything gets calculated correctly. Is there any fix for that? Thank you.

Edit: looks like root cause is the format with formula combination. Formulas like =IF etc are calcaulted. Formula =MAX(D2:D16) not. I can see that by testing the value inserted with bot. Excel function =ISNUMBER returns false but when valu entered by human it returns true. So need to find out how to pass values to excel in correct format probably.

Edit2: it works when I convert date taken by bot from SAP and converting it using script below before pasting to excel. If someone has any more elegant idea, I would appreciate that.

 

 
// Parse the string into parts
let [day, month, year] = DateAsString.split('.');

let dateUTC = new Date(Date.UTC(year, month - 1, day));

function formatDateToDDMMYYYY(date) {
  let d = date.getUTCDate().toString().padStart(2, '0');
  let m = (date.getUTCMonth() + 1).toString().padStart(2, '0');
  let y = date.getUTCFullYear();
  return `${d}.${m}.${y}`;
}
let DateAsDate = dateUTC;  // Date object at UTC midnight
return DateAsDate;  // Full Date object (UTC midnight)

entry.title: Send Outlook Email with Screenshot from last step
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have created an automation with "Screenshot" activity. As per documentation, the screenshot is by default stored at irpa_core.enums.path.log+'/Pictures/YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS_MS.png' location. I want to add this screenshot to the mail body. I have included Outlook SDK dependency and added steps to Open Outlook Instance, and Send Email (Outlook). How can I add the filename of the screenshot taken as attachment? SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: Request for Guidance on Notification Navigation in SAP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello expert,

I have a process as shown in the picture.

I want the process to send a notification to Work Zone after I complete the approval step. When I click on that notification, it should navigate to the app I configured. 

And currently, I’m able to send a notification to Work Zone after the approval step is completed, as shown in the screenshot below

Now, I would like to implement the navigation behavior when clicking on the notification. Could you please guide me on how to achieve this? 

I sincerely appreciate your kind guidance and continued support. Thank you very much!

Best regards,

Giang

entry.title: SAP Business Process Automation with Document Information Extraction - extract data using AI
entry.content:
Greetings,

I am building a automation process and want to use the activity "Extract Data Using AL (Premium), reference can be found here IRPA SDK V2.

It is marked as Alpha, so I'm not sure what that means. I am using Document Information Extraction SDK version 1.75.21 (the latest) but this activity is not available within the SDK. 

Can you please let me know when it will be available as it is key to the process I am building. As we have many document types I do not want to extract based on a template. We do have DOX premium service to allow for gen AI extraction based on the schema only.

Many thanks in advance for your help, Adrian

entry.title: Build process automation RDP mode and limitations on mouse click in virtual environments
entry.content:
Hi,

I would like to know how to find out mouse click limitations that can never be done even when RDP is configured. We have virtual environment where bots are running during lots of SAP Gui, excel or outlook automations without any issues. Once there was a scenario with two excel subsequent pop-ups where buttons needed to be clicked (click sync) that worked only when user was connected looking at the session - probably these pop ups were not recognized when user disconnected. After configuring RDP based on this - to be honest not quite intuitive documentation: (https://help.sap.com/docs/intelligent-robotic-process-automation/desktop-agent-user-guide/manage-unlock-with-desktop-agent?locale=en-US) it started to work even without user connected to session. Therefore I assume RDP has been set up correctly.

Now we have UI5 automation that needs to perform Mouse Click. And this mouse click is never performed when user is disconnected. Therefore I am looking for some simple way how to either doublecheck RDP configuration or how to find out exact situation when mouse clicks are not possible in virtual desktops. As this only says "certain circumstances":

 

So I would like to know what are these "certain circumstances" as when customer asks for some use case, basically we dont know whether its gonna work in VM or not until whole scenario is finished. Only at the end we find out that some elements do not react on click but only to mouse click. Also when using application recorder, all the buttons are recorded as click and later we find out they only react on mouse click.

Many thanks to product experts @cherry_li, @Chaitanya_Priya for any advice.

entry.title: Issue with ENOTFOUND Error in SAP Build Process Automation When Calling OData Service
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm currently working on SAP Build Process Automation and facing an issue while trying to consume an OData service in my workflow.

Destination configuration details in the sub account -

Proxy Type: OnPremise

Authentication: BasicAuthentication

Additional Properties: 

sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled = true

sap.processautomation.enabled = true

sap.build.usage = odata_gen

sap-client = 200

WebIDEUsage = Mobile

HTML5.DynamicDestination = true

Content-Type = application/json

The OData service is already deployed in actions and accessible from SAP Build, 

but while testing the automation, I am getting the following error:

{
"type": "automationActivity",
"name": "irpa_core.log",
"label": "Get entities from btpStatus",
"inputs": [
"Action execution resulted in ENOTFOUND with message getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND sap2dev.ormat.com",
{
"key": "Error",
"value": 1
},
null,
true
],
"containerInstanceUid": "22088b84-5108-4cd6-9180-eb2744befb47",
"parentInstanceUid": "22088b84-5108-4cd6-9180-eb2744befb47",
"stepId": "4",
"line": 21,
"file": "statusUpdateOdata.js"
},

{
  "label": "getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND sap2dev.ormat.com",
  "parentInstanceUid": "00453074-c80a-b760-e576-a25a1f7d0e64",
  "containerInstanceUid": "5e569caa-b259-4fb8-b51a-176caadab2fb",
  "line": 2,
  "file": "bundle.js",
  "exception": "irpa_core.error.Error",
  "stack": "Error: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND sap2dev.ormat.com     at Object.b [as cast] (C:\Users\saprpa\AppData\Local\SAP\Intelligent RPA\Projects\65287c4f-0b70-414b-a2f4-bccc626dca35\dist\bundle.js:2:204356)     at y.start (C:\Users\saprpa\AppData\Local\SAP\Intelligent RPA\Projects\65287c4f-0b70-414b-a2f4-bccc626dca35\dist\bundle.js:2:284311)     at async Object.p [as startJob] (C:\Users\saprpa\AppData\Local\SAP\Intelligent RPA\Projects\65287c4f-0b70-414b-a2f4-bccc626dca35\dist\bundle.js:2:278002)"
}

 

Can we use Proxy Type: OnPremise for OData services in SAP Build Process Automation, or is it recommended (or required) to use only Proxy Type: Internet (HTTP)?

I would appreciate clarification on whether OnPremise destinations are fully supported in SAP Build Process Automation workflows, especially when calling OData services inside automations.

 

Best Regards

Divan Wellalage

entry.title: Set Timeout to change Workflow Instance status from RUNNING to CANCELLED
entry.content:
Hi All,

Is there a configuration available through which I can set the maximum timeout for a workflow instance to stay in RUNNING and move to CANCELLED if not COMPLETED or ERRORNEOUS or SUSPENDED?

Thanks. SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: Fetch Workflow ID in Automation
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have created an automation and added step for Custom script and REST Call Web Service.

Within the custom script return payload, I want to return the workflow instance id through which this automation was triggered. Is there a variable available to fetch the id?

return {                    
        method: 'POST',                    
        url: '<endpoint>', 
        body: JSON.stringify({
        workflowid: ???
      })                    
    };
           

Thanks. SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: Transport process of BPA, BAS and IS projects in BTP
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I created Build Process Automation approval processes, Business Application Studio ui5 applications, and Integration Suite iFlows in BTP subaccount.

And I would like to transport these projects to test/PRD.

But since I'm new in BTP, I'm not so sure how to do it.

So, could you please advise which are the best practices to transport each of these projects?

And also, in BTP, dev/test/PRD means separated subaccounts?

Could you please answer my questions?

 

Thank You.

Best Regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: How to trigger a workflow in a shared environment via CpWf-API/Proxy-API? (SBPA, Process Automation)
entry.content:
Dear experts,

how can a workflow be triggered in a shared environment via CpWf-API/Proxy-API?

Do the requests (Start, Cancel) have to be created/executed manually?
In my opinion, that would be a step backwards.

I would appreciate any tips/information, as the blog post is no longer being updated.
https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/sap-build-process-automation-how-to-transition-to-shared-environment/ba-p/14049650

Best regards
Alexander

entry.title: Can We Bring “Import Financial Data” to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud? -Workflow Integration
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have implemented a Project Budget Approval Enhancement in SAP Public Cloud leveraging SAP BTP services. As part of this solution, we created the Import Financial Data app within SAP Work Zone to trigger the budget approval workflow. Once the workflow is triggered, the data is seamlessly transferred to the SAP Public Cloud.

We would like to know if there is a way to replicate the Import Financial Data app directly within SAP Public Cloud, since the current app is only available in SAP Work Zone.

entry.title: Issue Deploying SAP Build Process Automation: Application Not Active After Deployment
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m working through the official SAP Build Process Automation tutorial: Build Your First Business Process with SAP Build Process Automation.

On the last step (Run the Business Process), when I try to deploy my application, I get an error message. Despite the message, I continued and deployed the application, but after deployment, the application is not set to "active"—this is different from what is shown in the final step image in the tutorial.

Has anyone experienced this issue before? Does anyone know what this message means and how to solve the "not active" problem after deployment?

Any help or suggestions would be much appreciated!

Thanks!
